marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: From the two corporate actions above, PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem has the potential to receive funds of 9.9 trillion rupiah, so we estimate that the FTTH network construction planned by WIFI can be carried out organically or inorganically. Inorganic acquisition in the fiber optic industry in Indonesia is still possible. DealStreetAsia and Reuters reported in September 2024 that Link Net (LINK) and Indosat (ISAT) are exploring the sale of part or all of their shares in their fiber optic business, with transaction value ranges reported at around 400-500 million US dollars (6.6-8.3 trillion rupiah) and 1-2 billion US dollars (16.5-33 trillion rupiah) respectively. In general, we assess that WIFI's profitability has the potential to decrease along with this large expansion because the take-up rate will tend to be lower (vs. 2024 take-up rate: over 90%). Nevertheless, the potential decrease in profitability can be compensated by the potential for greater business growth, so the overall impact on WIFI's net profit is still positive. If WIFI decides to expand inorganically, investors also need to pay attention to the valuation of the acquisition transaction.

marketNews.title: China Announces Retaliatory Tariffs, Trade War Continues
marketNews.content: The Chinese government announced on April 11, 2025, that it will raise tariffs on all imported goods originating from the US from 84% to 125% effective April 12, 2025. The Chinese government also stated that China will from now on ignore further tariff increases from the US because the current tariff level is no longer economically rational, and mentioned that the tariff increases taken by the US government have become a joke. This announcement from the Chinese government came only one day after the US government stated on April 10, 2025, that total import tariffs originating from China reached 145%. US President Donald Trump, in a cabinet meeting on Thursday (10/4), said that he would love to make a trade deal with China to end the trade war. US Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, on the same occasion said that certainty regarding tariff policy will emerge after the US reaches an agreement with other countries.

marketNews.title: US CPI Inflation Eased in March 2025
marketNews.content: The US labor statistics bureau recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in the US eased to 2.4% YoY in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025: 2.8% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.6% YoY and marking the lowest inflation since September 2024. On a monthly basis, the US recorded CPI deflation of 0.1% MoM (vs. Feb 2025: 0.2% MoM inflation), below the consensus expectation which predicted 0.1% MoM inflation and marking the first deflation since May 2020. Meanwhile, core inflation eased to 2.8% YoY and 0.1% MoM (vs. Feb 2025: 3.1% YoY and 0.2% MoM inflation), both lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 3.0% YoY and 0.3% MoM inflation respectively, marking the lowest annual core inflation since March 2021.

marketNews.title: Government Prepares Funding for Red and White Village Cooperatives Supplying Free Lunch Program
marketNews.content: Minister of Cooperatives, Budi Arie Setiadi, said that the establishment of 80,000 Red and White village cooperatives requires a total fund of 400 trillion rupiah. Budi also mentioned that the Red and White village cooperatives will be suppliers for the free lunch program. Meanwhile, Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said that the funding to establish the Red and White village cooperatives will soon be compiled by the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises. Previously, Zulkifli stated in March 2025 that the government would involve state-owned bank associations (Himbara) to finance the village cooperatives.

marketNews.title: Government Prepares Regulation for Online Ride-Hailing Drivers to Receive Annual Holiday Bonus
marketNews.content: Vice Minister of Manpower, Emmanuel Ebenezer, said on Thursday (10/4) that the government is preparing regulations to guarantee that online ride-hailing (ojol) drivers and online couriers receive an annual holiday bonus (BHR). Emmanuel explained that the related regulation is currently being reviewed by the Ministry of State Secretariat.

marketNews.title: National Shrimp Sales Decline 20-30% Due to US Reciprocal Tariffs
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Shrimp Club Indonesia, Andi Tamsil, told Kontan on Friday (11/4) that national shrimp sales have decreased by about 20-30% since the US government announced a reciprocal tariff of 32% for Indonesia. Andi explained that 90% of national shrimp production is intended for export markets, with 70% of total national shrimp exports destined for the US market.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Plans Rp5.9 Trillion Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI) plans to hold a rights issue of up to approximately 2.95 billion new shares with an exercise price of 2,000 rupiah per share, a 4:5 ratio, and a dilution effect of up to 55.56%. The potential proceeds from this plan are around 5.9 trillion rupiah, which will be used as capital injection to its business entity, PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem, for the construction of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) networks for 4 million homepasses in Java Island. As of the end of 2024, WIFI held 99.7% of shares in PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem. The cum-rights date in the regular and negotiated market is June 11, 2025, with the rights execution period on June 17-23, 2025. In a separate transaction, WIFI announced that the Japanese telecommunications company, Nippon Telegraph and Telephone East Corporation (NTT East), has injected capital worth 4 trillion rupiah into PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem. After this transaction, NTT East owns 49% of PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem shares. On Friday (11/4), WIFI's stock price closed up +13.6% at the level of 2,250 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Estimates Gold Bar Sales Increased by +30% YoY in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: HRTA: The Investor Relations Director of Hartadinata Abadi, Thendra Crisnanda, told Bloomberg that the company estimates its gold bar sales in 1Q25 jumped by approximately +30% YoY. This estimate marks the sharpest annual sales increase in one quarter since HRTA went public in 2017.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Targets Oil and Gas Production to Increase +10â€“15% YoY in 2025
tickerNews.content: ENRG: The Investor Relations Advisor for Energi Mega Persada, Herwin W. Hidayat, said that the company targets an oil and gas production increase of approximately +10-15% YoY throughout 2025. To support this target, ENRG allocates capex of about 150-170 million US dollars in 2025. During 2024, ENRG recorded gross oil production of 8,097 barrels per day (+22% YoY) and gross gas production of 229 million cubic feet per day (-7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTPP targets New Contract Value to rise +7-11% YoY in 2025, targets net profit growth of +19-23% YoY
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP targets the new contract value obtained throughout 2025 to rise by about +7-11% YoY with net profit targeted to grow by around +19-23% YoY, based on the company's annual report. This new contract value target is higher than the statement by PTPP Corporate Secretary, Joko Raharjo, who in January 2025 said that PTPP targeted the new contract value during 2025 to grow by +5% YoY. In the annual report, PTPP also targets the ratio of total interest-bearing debt to equity to improve by around 45% YoY in 2025. However, PTPP's management proposes not to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year.

tickerNews.title: MAIN Management Proposes 2024 Final Dividend with a Payout Ratio of Approximately 30%
tickerNews.content: MAIN: Malindo Feedmill management proposes a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year with a payout ratio of approximately 30%, implying a dividend of 146.4 billion rupiah or 65 rupiah per share. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 22, 2025. Referring to MAIN's stock price closing on Friday (11/4) at 720 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is approximately 9%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Shareholders Approve Final Dividend of 11 Rupiah per Share and Buyback Plan Up to 1 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: AVIA: Avia Avian shareholders on Thursday (10/4) approved the plan to distribute a final dividend of 11 rupiah per share. The cum date and payment date are not yet known. Referring to AVIA's stock price closing on Friday (11/4) at 400 rupiah per share, the indicative final dividend yield is approximately 2.8%. Previously, AVIA also distributed an interim dividend of 11 rupiah per share in November 2024. Besides dividends, AVIA shareholders also approved a share buyback plan with a fund allocation of up to 1 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PAM Mineral Controller Buys 3.2 Million NICL Shares at 324 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: NICL: The controller of PAM Mineral, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, bought 3.2 million NICL shares at a price of 324 rupiah per share on April 10, 2025. The total transaction value reaches approximately 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.039% to 0.07%.

tickerNews.title: HITS Plans Go Private and Voluntary Delisting, Tender Offer Period Estimated in June-July 2025
tickerNews.content: HITS: Humpuss Intermoda Transportasi plans to go private and conduct a voluntary delisting, which will be discussed at the independent GMS on May 21, 2025. The voluntary tender offer price has not been announced, while the voluntary tender execution is estimated to take place from June 13 to July 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BPJS Ketenagakerjaan Plans to Double Local Equity Portion in Portfolio Within the Next 3 Years
tickerNews.content: Investment Development Director of BPJS Ketenagakerjaan, Edwin Ridwan, told Reuters on Friday (11/4) that the agency plans to double the local equity portion in its portfolio to 20% of its assets under management (AUM) within the next 3 years. Edwin mentioned that the agency has gradually increased investments in the stock market - especially in big market cap stocks - since the recent decline in the IHSG. BPJS Ketenagakerjaan currently manages social security funds worth 48 billion US dollars and is the largest institutional investor in Indonesia. Of these funds, approximately 4.8 billion US dollars are placed in the stock market or through mutual funds.

tickerNews.title: Gold Spot Price Closed Up +1.27% to 3,216.11 USD per Troy Ounce, Driven by Global Uncertainty Amid US-China Trade War Escalation
tickerNews.content: The price of gold in the spot market closed up +1.27% at 3,216.11 US dollars per troy ounce on Friday (11/4), after reaching an all-time high of 3,277.23 US dollars per troy ounce during intraday trading on the same day. The increase in gold prices was driven by global uncertainty following the escalation of the trade war between the US and China.
